Name: Portrait Head of Ptolemy the Third
Description: The bust of Ptolemy the Third Euergetes, sculpted in fine white marble, most likely belonged originally to a full statue. The upper left part of the head and lower left part of the chest are broken. The head, slightly tilted to the left, has fine facial features. The eyes look upward, the nose is sharp, and the hair is wavy. The face and the neck are fleshy.
